question: Who's "she?"
answer: His girlfriend, Marie. She was killed in India three weeks ago.

question: A dirty section chief in league with a corrupt Russian Billionaire commits suicide when confronted by Jason Bourne. You couldn't make this stuff up. You watched this happen? Bourne's last confirmed location is Moscow, three days ago?
answer: Right.

question: So what does he do now?
answer: I think he's looking for something he hasn't found.

question: Like what? What's he after?
answer: I'm not sure. Maybe he hasn't gotten his memory back yet. Not all of it.

question: Pam, what I need to know is, what kind of a threat is he to us?
answer: If he just wanted to hurt us he could have sent this tape to CNN.

question: Where is my sister?
answer: She's dead. She was killed.

question: I knew it was going to end this way. It was always going to end this way...
answer: I didn't believe that.

question: Why did she die?
answer: She was shot. A man came for me.

question: And then you killed him. Now what?
answer: Someone started all this...and I'm going to find them. Who started Treadstone? Just tell me what I want to know! You know something. Tell me where to start looking. They give me the name I want, or I burn their entire house down to get it.

question: We tracked the phone. Registered to a London reporter named Simon Ross. He works at the Guardian newspaper.
answer: You tracking him?

question: Yeah, thanks Mike. We have a survey team covering him at work...and a sneak and peek's on their way to his apartment.
answer: Well, who talked to him? How did he find out about Blackbriar?

question: We don't know, we pulled his background and ran a cross check on any known anomalies, but we've come up with nothing. But, I think if we follow Ross, we are going to be able...
answer: Right. Ross is easy. I want the source.

question: Is that all?
answer: Yeah.

question: I want rendition protocols and I want the asset put on standby, just in case. People, listen up, this is a full priority situation
answer: Jimmy, give me Ross's profile on one.

question: What's he doing? I thought we blocked his cell? Who the hell is he talking to???
answer: Jimmy, I need that phone!

question: Activate the asset.
answer: Sir, we haven't yet become operational --

question: Why do you know so much about me?
answer: What?

question: The article. You talked to someone from Treadstone. Someone there at the beginning. What's his name?
answer: I can't tell you that.... Who's following me?

question: Whoever they are it's trouble.
answer: Are they Blackbriar?

question: Blackbriar, what's Blackbriar?
answer: I don't know. I heard the name this morning for the first time. Whatever it is, my source said it started with you.

question: What? What are you talking about?
answer: Look, just help me get away from these people...and we can talk more...we can--

question: Three o'clock. Female. Blonde black top.
answer: Has she seen me?

question: Not yet. Dip left past the photo kiosk. Straight ahead. News kiosk. Change of plan. Stop. Tie your shoelace.
answer: Are we clear?

question: Clear. News kiosk. Straight ahead.
answer: Straight toward me. Bin man?

question: Negative.
answer: He's got a gun.

question: Alright, I want to take him now. Get him out of there and have the asset cover it.
answer: Keep moving... Faster.... The front... INSIDE! Service doorway -- Now!

question: Close him down...
answer: Keep moving. Through the store room.

question: I'm going to get you to safety but you have to stay calm do exactly what I say.
answer: Sure, okay.

question: No, listen to me
answer: Yes.

question: Stay here while I look for an escape.
answer: I can see the entrance from here I can make it out--

question: It's Vosen. We have a situation. Sparkling. And a "Heart-Healthy" omelet with goat cheese and peppers. You're late. Traffic?
answer: Nothing for me.

question: I'm buying. When the Director called, it was suggested we bring you on--
answer: Suggested? Are you sure it was just a suggestion?

question: Funny how different things look depending on where you sit. I look at this as doing a favor for you. Giving you an opportunity to complete some unfinished business.
answer: Meaning?

question: Jason Bourne.
answer: Bourne's finished.

question: Really?
answer: It was finished the moment I realized I was chasing him for something he didn't do. The case is closed.

question: So what do you make of this? French intel picked up Bourne meeting Pierre Elattrache on Tuesday. He threatened to burn our house down if you didn't tell him who started Treadstone. That's a big problem, wouldn't you agree?
answer: This doesn't feel like Bourne to me.

question: Why's it so hard for you to believe?
answer: Probably because it's coming from you, Noah.

question: Lets try and be adults okay? We all thought he was done, off the grid. But Bourne's back. Maybe he's a threat. We both want the same thing here.
answer: So what happened at Waterloo?

question: We have a leak. Bourne showed up in our surveillance. We had very little time to react.
answer: And the reporter ended up dead?

question: Bourne saw us coming.
answer: So what was he doing? The real question is how you managed to get in a fire fight in the middle of a public train station.

question: Don't second guess an operation from an armchair, Pam. It's not fair.
answer: I'm going to the office now. I'll make my own introductions.

question: Let's do names later. What's Bourne's last fixed position? Anybody. Status? Wounded? Armed? Where are your grids coming from?
answer: NSA Tactical.

question: You have an Echelon package?
answer: Yes.

question: Why isn't it on?
answer: We were waiting.

question: For what? You're nine hours behind the toughest target you've ever tracked. I want everyone to sit down, strap in, and turn on all you've got. That would mean now. Thank you. I want everything you've got on Ross on screen one.
answer: Sir, we just hacked Ross's email account at the Guardian and found a round trip ticket to Turin, yesterday. 0800 arrival, 12:05 departure.

question: I think we can be pretty certain that Bourne's not your source then?
answer: How?

question: Ross's call to his editor, where he said he just met the source on Blackbriar, took place just after his flight landed. His met his source in Turin.
answer: So?

question: The guy you're after is a CIA operative with clearance above Top Secret. He was committing treason by talking to Ross. Do you really think, while doing that, he used a cell phone he knows we can track?
answer: Do you have a better idea?

question: Yeah, I'd look at all the people whose cell phones were switched off the entire period Ross was in Turin.
answer: Do it Jimmy.

question: Hello.
answer: Who is this?

question: This is Nicky Parsons. Who's this?
answer: Nicky, I need to do an ID challenge first. Code in

question: Response
answer: Nicky, this is Noah Vosen. How long have you been on site?

question: I just walked in.
answer: We have two officers on site. Are you in contact with them?

question: They're down. Unconscious, but alive.
answer: Is there any sign of Daniels?

question: Issue a standing kill order on Jason Bourne, effective immediately. We lost Bourne.
answer: You still think he's after Daniels?

question: Yeah. Nicky's just the means. But if we find Daniels, we'll find Bourne.
answer: Daniels knows way too much. Daniels knows everything. We can't let them meet.

question: I'll take care of it.
answer: Good. And fill Hirsch in. Just in case.

question: What are you after, Jason? Why are you looking for Daniels?
answer: Do you know who this is?

question: That's Daniels. I don't know who that is.
answer: I have to get back to the beginning...or I'll never be free of this.

question: Who is he?
answer: I think he started Treadstone. I remember meeting him. I remember the first day... Daniels brought me to him.

question: What happened?
answer: An initiation...I guess...

question: Jason...that wasn't some one-off initiation. Daniels said they did that to you over and over again. That's how they...
answer: Why are you helping me?

question: It was difficult for me...with you. You really don't remember anything?
answer: No. We should move.

question: Since when do you have authorization for lethal action against Daniels?
answer: Since he cleaned out a Blackbriar safe and fled to Morocco!

question: So grab him--
answer: I don't have the people on the ground to do that and I'm not going to risk that file falling into the wrong hands.

question: What's going on? What's Daniels got?
answer: What's he got? He ran all of Blackbriar's operations in Southern Europe and North Africa.

question: I think the world's well aware we have a rendition and lethal action capability at this point, Noah.
answer: For Christ's sake, Pam, he's got our entire playbook. Names, dates, ghost sites, how we train our assets.....

question: You still don't have the authority to kill him.
answer: Oh, yes I do, Pam. That's what makes us special. No red tape. No more getting badguys in our sights and then watching them escape while we wait for some bureaucrat to issue the order.

question: You just decide? No oversight. No checks and balances.
answer: Come on, Pam, you've seen the raw intel. You know how real the threat is. We can't afford to have our hands tied like that anymore.

question: His location's being blocked.
answer: Now they found Daniels, do you know where he is?

question: They'll get one of the operatives to terminate him.
answer: Find out who.

question: Desh.
answer: Tell him you're going to meet him and that you have a new phone for him.

question: If you stop Desh they'll just get someone else.
answer: We're not going to stop him. We're going to follow him. He'll take us right to Daniels.

question: That's where Parson's is. When we're finished with Daniels send the asset after her. We find Parsons, we find Bourne.
answer: Noah, what are you doing?

question: Not now.
answer: Now. I want to know what's going on.

question: Not now.
answer: I'm asking on what basis you're continuing this operation.

question: On the basis that Nicky Parsons has compromised a covert operation. She is up to her neck in it.
answer: This is about Daniels, not Nicky!

question: She has betrayed us!
answer: You don't know the circumstances!

question: She's in league with Jason Bourne for Chrissake!
answer: You don't have the authority to kill her or Bourne!

question: Yes, I do Pam, it's right here and it's legal.
answer: She's one of our own. You start down this path...where does it end?!

question: Pam, You need to see this. This passport just cleared Immigration at JFK ten minutes ago. It's an early Treadstone identity registered to Jason Bourne but he never used it and it never went to the grid. Bourne's alive.
answer: They don't know.

question: No, if they knew Vosen wouldn't be in his office right now.
answer: It's a hell of a risk.

question: Yeah. Maybe Bourne wants us to know, just like Naples, maybe he's communicating. Maybe he's trying to communicate with you.
answer: Maybe we should communicate back. Because I think I know what Bourne's looking for. Pamela Landy.

question: Check Landy's phone. Is she using it? Nothing? No calls since Bourne-- ? What the hell do you mean we can't read it?
answer: Working on it--

question: How do you know a text came if you can't read it-- Are we on Landy?
answer: Six men. More on the way.

question: I want that goddamn text. We need to get out in front of her!
answer: Seconds... Got it!

question: Surround it. Anyone not on Landy goes to Tudor City. Now! Get the trucks. We're going mobile. Get the map up. He wouldn't have chosen it if he didn't have a reason. As soon as you have eyes on Landy, I want to know. Copy that, I see her. Any sign of Bourne? Noah Vosen.
answer: This is Jason Bourne.

question: How did you get this number?
answer: You didn't actually think I was coming to Tudor City, did you?

question: No, I guess not. But if it's me you want to talk to maybe we can arrange a meet.
answer: Where are you right now?

question: In my office.
answer: I doubt that. If you were in your office-- We'd be having this conversation face-to-face.

question: What just happened?
answer: Bourne got into Vosen's safe.

question: What?!
answer: Where to?

question: 415 East 71st Street.
answer: 4.15.71... Jesus, Pam.

question: ...I want the entire building searched. Every room. Every hallway. Every closet. Every goddamm airduct. Do you understand? I want him found! Lethal force is authorized.
answer: I told-

question: Tell them again!
answer: Block every exit. I want a full perimeter on Port Authority-- Box him in! Box him in! He's on the roof. He's trapped. We've got him! He's got nowhere to run!

question: Take him out! He did what?!
answer: Who has eyeball on him?! Who has eyeball?! Don't tell me-- --you've lost him! Who's on street level?! Street level backup?!

question: The asset lost Bourne. We lost him.
answer: Sir, this may be nothing but, look at Bourne's birthday.

question: What about it?
answer: Well, Landy told Bourne his birthday was 4/15/71 so...

question: I know. Go! Go! Drive! We're already on our way. Turn the teams around. Bring them in behind me. Bourne knows everything. I think he's heading for you right now.
answer: He's coming home, Noah. How long do I have?

question: Not long. Get out of there.
answer: No. I'm going to stay.

question: Are you crazy, he'll--
answer: He'll come to the training wing. That's what he knows. I'll keep him in play until you arrive.

question: They'll kill you for giving me this place.
answer: 4/15/71 isn't much of a code. My guess is Vosen's already on his way.

question: Why'd you do it?
answer: This isn't us, David. What they turned you into, what they're doing with Blackbriar... This has to stop.

question: Then stop it. Everything you need is in there.
answer: David... Come in with me. It's better if we do this together.

question: This is where it started for me, this is where it ends.
answer: Oh, my God...

question: Put the gun down. I wouldn't be here if I didn't want to talk.
answer: I've spent three years running. Three years trying to find out who I was.

question: You still don't have it all back, do you? You haven't filled in all the pieces?
answer: Let's start with the moment you found out I wouldn't execute Wombosi. The amnesia wasn't the issue, it was the fact that I didn't pull the trigger....

question: One lapse meant your conditioning had failed.
answer: It was always you, behind Conklin, behind Abbott.... They were just following orders.

question: I'm unarmed, Jason.
answer: "David." I'm David Webb.

question: You were David Webb, but not anymore.
answer: Why me? Why did you pick me?

question: You really don't remember, do you? You picked us, Jason.
answer: What does that mean?

question: You volunteered. You volunteered right here.... You didn't even blink, Jason. You just handed me these... Has everything been explained to you.
answer: Yes, sir.

question: You were a soldier ready to serve his country. Just like thousands of others, except you were a prodigy with languages...and a perfect shot. Your missions will save American lives.
answer: You said I'd be saving American lives. Instead you just turned me into a killer.

question: You could have left at any time. And you knew exactly what it meant for you if you chose to stay. When we're finished with you, you'll no longer be David Webb.
answer: I'll be whoever you need me to be, sir.

question: Stop running from the truth, Jason. You chose to come here! You chose to stay! And no matter how much you want to forget it...eventually you're going to have to face how you chose, right there, to become Jason Bourne! You haven't slept for a long time have you David? Have you made a decision? This can't go on, you know. You have to decide.
answer: Who is he?

question: We've been through that.
answer: What did he do?
